What

Split server into (mostly) isolated divisions
Segregate own objects (e.g., questionnaires, interviews, assignments, etc.)
Restrict user access by workspace (i.e., whitelist users)
Allow only admin access to all workspaces
See more here

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Types


For field operations

Interviewer


Supervisor


Observer


Headquarters


For technical tasks

Admin


API

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
For field operations

Interviewer. Complete interviews,
Supervisor. Reassign work, review interviews.
Headquarters. Manages survey:

Creates users (i.e., Interviewer, Supervisor)
Imports interviews
Creates assignments
Reviews interviews
Exports data

Observer. Like Headquarters, but can only observe.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
For technical tasks

Admin. Like “super” Headquarters.

Can do everything Headquarters can.
Can do things Headquarters cannot:

Create workspaces.
Create all users (including Headquarters).


API. Like “super” Headquarters, but through API rather than GUI

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Roadmap 

What


Why


How

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
What


Fact 1: Headquarters distributes questionnaires


Fact 2: Questionnaires need to come from somewhere


Fact 3: Designer is that somewhere


Fact 4: Importing copies a questionnaire snapshot from Designer to Headquarters


Fact 5: Headquarters manages several different questionnaire snapshots as versions

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why



Get started 

During initial server, must import questionnaire before assignments can be made.





Update 

When changes happen to the questionnaire, must import changes from Designer to Headquarters (e.g., add questions, correct conditions, etc.)





Test 

When developing, may want to import to test (e.g., see how works on Interviewer, distribute tests to tablets, etc.)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How




Video




Click on the Survey Setup menu
Select Questionnaires
Click on IMPORT QUESTIONNAIRE
Enter login and password for Designer
Click to select a questionnaire

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Modify inputs


Objectives 🎯
TODO: list requirements for raw -> assignment
For ZiHBS example:

Load raw data
Transform character provience to categorical


TODO: adapt code to example created for slides


* =============================================================================
* Set paths
* =============================================================================

* !!! WARNING !!! Put your paths here before executing
local dir_in "C:/your/path"
local dir_out "`dir_in'"

* =============================================================================
* Data preparation
* =============================================================================

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Import the sample to be assigned
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

import delimited using "`dir_in'/example_sample.tsv", ///
    varnames(1) /// treat first line as variable names
    clear

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Transform columns into those expected by SuSo
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* convert from numeric to string
rename province province_old
gen province = 
gen days_preferred = .

replace province = 1 if province_old == "Bulawayo
replace province = 2 if province_old == "Harare
replace province = 3 if province_old == "Manicaland
replace province = 4 if province_old == "Mashonaland Central
replace province = 5 if province_old == "Mashonaland East
replace province = 6 if province_old == "Mashonaland West
replace province = 7 if province_old == "Masvingo
replace province = 8 if province_old == "Matabeleland North
replace province = 9 if province_old == "Matabeleland South
replace province = 10 if province_old == "Midlands

* rename variables to match expected name

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Check modifications


Objectives emoji::emoji("target")

Check that required columns are present
Confirm that columns contain right type of data


TODO: adapt to Capturing What Matters Example


* ==============================================================================
* Check modifications
* ==============================================================================

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Confirm that data contain desired columns
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

#delim ;
local vars "
province
ea
hh_num
hh_head
";
#delim cr

foreach var of local vars {
    confirm variable `var'
}

* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
* Check that columns contain desired data format
* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

* TODO

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Export tab-delimited output


Objectives 🎯

Export to tab-delimited format
Save where expected




* =============================================================================
* Export to a tab-delimited file
* =============================================================================

export delimited using 
    "`dir_out'/assignments_to_import.tab", /// where to write the file
    delimiter(tab)  /// tab-delimited format
    nolabel         /// how to handle labelled data: write numbers; not labels
    replace

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Design phase

DesignerDeveloper




Profile

Knows context
Masters subject matter (e.g., anthro, agriculture, etc.)
Has past experience with same/similar survey


Actions

Provides conceptual architecture for system
Decides on validation rules
Dictates what to monitor







Profile

Past experience with data management
Proficient in least one statistical programming language


Actions

Writes code to check data
Seeks input/guidance from subject matter experts
Provides documentation/training to implementers

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Implementation phase

ManagerMonitor




Profile

Past experience with data management
Proficient in least one statistical programming language
Understands data quality system technically

Either knows the codebase
Or can talk with someone who does



Actions

Manages data quality programs

Runs scripts, if not automated
Remedies errors, if any

Manages manual processes, if any

Runs non-automated code (e.g., reject interviews once review complete)
Distributes files (e.g., review assignments for monitors)

Oversees monitors

Manages monitors (e.g., allocates, monitors, and helps monitors)
Provides technical support (e.g., review cases on SuSo, inspect data, etc.)








Profile

Knows survey instrument(s)
Understands data quality system procedurally

Knows processes and how they are linked
Knows their role in the overall system

Masters the method for reviewing interviews (e.g., SuSo HQ, R/Stata to review data, etc.)


Actions

Review assigned cases carefully

Review issues flagged by data system
Read comments interview- and/or question-level comments, if any
Scrutinize data (e.g., assess whether answers make sense)
Decide on action to take and feedback to leave

Seek input from the field promptly

Seek clarifications on comments
Call supervisor/interviewer with questions

title: Learning Survey Solutions

Practice interviews


Group

Simulated interview

Two participants
One plays the interviewer
Other the respondent

Everyone else follows

Listens to the exchange
Captures the data

Pause periodically for feedback

On interview
On CAPI app usage




Pair

Simulated interview

Divide all participants into two-person groups
One plays the interviewer
Other the respondent
Both capture data

Pause periodically

Change role within group
Collect questions / comments from all groups
Provide feedback




Field

Real interview

Identify out-of-sample respondents
Follow all survey protocols

Supervise interviews

Sit in part of interview
Get post-interview debrief

Provide feedback

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Types of testing

Unit


Integration / Functional


Smoke


End-to-end


Performance


Reference: https://www.atlassian.com/continuous-delivery/software-testing/types-of-software-testing

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Unit testing


TODO: image of a condition to check

Definition
Check that the smallest units of code work
Examples

Skip works correctly
Validation fires appropriately
Answers filter properly

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Integration / Functional testing


TODO: images of script on one side; outcome on the other

Definition
Check that parts of system work together as expected
Examples

Script creates right inputs for SuSo preloading
Preloading leads to right skip behavior for panel households

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Smoke testing


TODO: image/video of tester checking skips

Definition
Since testing may be expensive, quickly check for problems in functionality (“smoke”) that may indicate problems needed careful inspection (“fire”)
Examples

Major skips work
Application data contains desired variables

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
End-to-end testing


TODO: image/video of filling interview in tester–potentially same as for prior slide

Definition
Click through the whole application manually
Examples
Complete questionnaire, ideally with different completion paths

Complete agricultural module for one household
Complete non-agricultural enterprise module for another household

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Performance testing


TODO: image of tablet with several interviews on it

Definition
Check how app works operating under a particular load
Examples
App works well under field conditions:

Large sections are fully completed
Full interview completed
Several interviews completed on device

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Testing tools

Tester


Interviewer

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How


TODO: video of:

Open questionnaire
Click on TEST
Fill questionnaire



Navigate to Designer
Open a questionnaire
Click on TEST

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why


TODO: video of:

launching from Designer
updating when application changes while keeping data



Fast. Click of 1 button.
Available. From inside Designer/browser.
Live updates. In sync with changes in Designer.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why not


Ephemeral. Session expires quickly. Leaves no data.
Internet. Requires continuous internet connection.
Access. Requires Designer account + acces to app.
Incomplete. No visibility on other things to test:

Preloading data
Synchronizing
Finding assignments
How tablet works with app
Etc.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
How


TODO: video of process

In 

Create users
Import questionnaires
Create fake data for ID variables
Create assignments from fake data

In 

Sync
Complete assignments

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why

More control. Which version to test. Which cases to test. Who tests what.
More informative. Evaluate the performance of the app on the tablet.
More permanence. Saves issues encountered as well as data for producing them.
More independence. Can enter across several sessions and offline.

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Why not

More setup. Need to setup whole survey architecture: questionnaire, users, assignments, etc.
More complexity. Must enter as during data collection.

Server 


Tablets

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Roadmap 

Server 


Tablets 


Routers 


Other equipment

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Requirements


Hard




https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/faq/server-requirements/

Soft

Supports expected load
Scalable to increased load if needed

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Options

Local


Cloud

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Local


👍

You manage your server
Server physically on-prem
Data stored on-prem


👎



You NEED to manage everything about your server



Power supply


Computational resources


Backup


Redundancy


Monitoring


Security


Etc.



You must pay for the costs of the above
Your security is only as good as:

On-prem physical security
In-house digital security protections

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Cloud


👍

Someone else manages your server infrastructure (for a small monthly fee)
Easily scale resources as a function of needs (e.g. more RAM, more storage, etc.)
Better security, easier
Easy to script deployment


👎

Procurement requires a credit or prepaid card to pay service provider
Deployment may require new skills (e.g., learning provider’s services, how to orchestrate services, etc.)
Clearance for cloud deployment may be harder to obtain (even if it’s generally cheaper and more secure)

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Requirements


Hard





https://docs.mysurvey.solutions/faq/what-tablets-should-i-buy-/

Soft

More RAM -> faster performance
Reputable manufacturer

Better product
Better (public) support
More updates

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Other considerations

If planning for offline interview transfer, equipped with …

… Bluetooth
… WiFi Direct

If GPS points or area matter …

… number satellite constellations (GPS, Glonas, Beidou, etc.)
… Bluetooth to connect with GPS devices

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Number to buy


Field team

Supervisor
Interviewer


Backup

Per team, kept with the team
Additional, kept with the head office


Others

For extra field staff trained but not hired
For the head office team, to replicate issues flagged by the field

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Requirements

Connect with mobile internet service provider
4G or 5G connection strongly recommended

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Number to buy


Field team
One per team

Backup
Kept with the head office

Others

For extra field staff trained but not hired
For the head office team, to be connected while on field supervision mission

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Other considerations

Mobile, with battery for autonomuous usage
Unlocked, so can use SIM card of other internet service providers, as needed

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Charging  


Battery packs

Smaller for each field worker (e.g., 8k mAh)
Larger ones for teams (e.g., 30k mAh)


Charger

Power strip, so team can charge multiple tablets at once over night
Plug adapters, if tablet has different plug than country

title: Learning Survey Solutions
text:
Protection 


Case

One per tablet
Consider a small number of extras, since typically not replaced


Screen protector

One per tablet
Consider small number of extras, but larger number than of cases. Screen protectors might be replaced more regularly.
